node.text:
Here’s a quick cardio workout to get you into the swing of things if you haven’t already.

All you need are some dumbbells.

Perform the circuit or complex as follows: - DB push-ups 5
- Mountain climbers 10/side
- Squat thrusts 15
- Thrusters 20

X 6-8 rounds or stop after 15-20 mins.

What do you think? Will you “just do it?”

Are you eating too little to lose fat? ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Here's where I help you clear up the confusion surrounding this myth.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Also, if you truly believe that you're eating too little then you shouldn't have any worries when you overeat eh?! Your weight should be dropping like nobodies business these last few days (sarcasm).
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Eating more in the long-term will NOT speed up FAT LOSS. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
BUT ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Eating more in the short-term may lead to weight loss for some people.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Being in a calorie deficit is stressful to the body. Being in a massive calorie deficit where you eat super clean and barely enough to get you through the next hour places even greater stress on your body.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
This leads to water retention. There are many other reasons you could be retaining extra water too, such as eating a super high fibre diet which you're not accustomed leading to bloating.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
In this situation, you can lose weight when you increase your intake, leading to this misguided notion that you need to eat more to lose weight. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Weight loss does NOT equate to fat loss.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
To lose fat, you have to be in a consistent calorie deficit. The larger the energy deficit the faster the fat loss. If this were not the case then people wouldn't look skeletal or die of starvation in 3rd world countries where food is not abundant or easily accessible.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Have you ever received the advice to eat more to lose fat? I hear it all the time, even from my peers. Remember, run the other way if someone tells you this. Unless they're specifically telling you to eat more to lose WEIGHT to give you a psychological and motivational boost.

Do you feel fat and bloated after all the festive eating and drinking?
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
It's ok to feel like that. Don't be so distressed or hard on yourself.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Don't be stressed and worried about what exercise you need to do or how much of it to make up for your indulgence. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
You did what you did and hopefully made some great memories along the way. It's time to move on and get right back to what you were doing before.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
It really is as simple as that. Don't overcomplicate it.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Anyhow, overeating has likely increased your lean body mass and that extra layer of fat that you're wearing is probably the result of the extra water retention from eating way more carbs and sodium than usual.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Maybe you didn't sleep so well the last few days either. This also doesn't help with water retention. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
BTW, there's nothing wrong with water retention. It happens and it's normal.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
When's your next workout and nutritious meal? Let me know in the comments.

Cardio to maintain your muscle and train your core.

Read to the end to find out how to maximise core stimulation.

Do you want a quick cardio workout that’ll help preserve your lean body mass? 
Do this trap bar complex.

You’re probably wondering how this works your core. It’s the farmers walks. 
A top tip to really activate your core is to come to dead stop and with your core braced turn as fast as possible with the weight completely under control.

Give it a try and tell me you don’t feel it the next couple of days.

Key me know if you want more of these style of workouts in the comments by commenting: “I want more!” #cardio #trapbar #hiit #hkfitness #fitnesshk #減肥 #bbghk #hkgym #fitnessmalaysia #malaysiafitness #singaporefitness #fitnesssingapore #sgfitness #sgfitfam

You're probably not going to finish the sentence but here goes anyway.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Get your thinking hats on or your creative juices flowing.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
"Drinking alcohol leads to slower..."
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Best answer gets absolutely nothing LOL!

Why you're not losing weight as a parent.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
I was walking around a shopping centre and I could feel and see a familiar warm yellow glow in my peripheral vision. It was the famed Golden Arches of McDonald's.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Not only did it catch my attention, but it also caught the eye of a preschool child who was whining and insisting that her parents take her to McD's.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
The parents were mildly resistant. Actually, they were about as resistant as oil, and the child duly got her own way and off she merrily went to get her Happy Meal. I'm not judging the parents for allowing their child to eat McDonald's but I am judging them for allowing their child dictate what they eat.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
If it were up to most kids to decide on what to eat it would be ice cream, fish fingers, chips (fries), crisps (chips LOL) or anything else that is ultra-easy on the palate at every meal.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Just like the scenario above you end up eating the same Calhorrific (calorific) foods as your child but guess who doesn't need the extra calories? YOU.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
And then the inevitable happens they can't finish their meal. Guess who intervenes and laps it all up? YOU!
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
No wonder you're finding it challenging to lose weight.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
You might justify it as not wanting to waste food but whatever the reason the problems start when you spoil your kids. There, I said it. You spoiled your kids. You let them have all the power and regaining it is no easy task once it's lost.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Whether you're letting them have their way because you love them and want them to be happy or because you just don't want every meal to be a war of attrition, i.e. you don't need every meal to turn into a food fight and you want an easy life - there are no winners.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
It's time to make a change and it starts with you for the benefit of you and your kids.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
If you're a parent who allows your child to choose what they want for their meals because you're worried they won't eat then you're doing a disservice to them and yourself. Sorry but that's the harsh reality.

Foam roller for a stronger core.

Do you want a stronger core?

Give this a go if you want to strengthen your core and light up your abs.

Foam rolling is useful and can either be torture or very enjoyable. Either ways, don’t fall into the trap of doing it  so long that it detracts from your training.

If you have a foam roller that’s gathering dust or you foam role as part of your warmup then give this core exercise a whirl and build it into your routine.

Remember not to allow your lower back to arch and keep your glutes tensed.  #hkpersonaltrainer #personaltrainerhk #hongkongpersonaltrainer #hkgym #減肥 #減肥日記 #bbghk #hkfitnessgirl #hongkongfitness #fitnesshk #hkfitness

You wouldn't hang out with people that talk to you the way you sometimes talk to yourself.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Don't be so hard on yourself. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Sure, you may have had one cookie too many or eaten the whole tub of icecream. You might have even woken up in the middle of the night to raid the fridge because that's when nobody's around to witness your indulgence.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Maybe you missed a workout or two or three.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
And this leaves you feeling frustrated with yourself. Angry. And you berate yourself saying things like: "I'm such an idiot", "I'm useless" or "I'm such a failure".
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Whatever the snafu it doesn't warrant you talking to yourself like that. Would you take that kind of talk from a friend?
I hope not.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Anyhow, be kind and forgiving to yourself because you are worthy and you're always only one meal or one workout away from getting right back on track. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
#fitnessquote #nevergiveuponyou #weightlossfamily #dietmode #mindsetmatters #makingbetterchoices #nutritioncoaching #weightlosss #appetitecontrol #dietingtips #hkfitness #mealplanning #dietblog #fatlossgoals #weightlossjourney #losingweight #dietmotivation  #weightlossplan #dietproblems #hkfitness #fitnesshk #減肥 #bbghk #hkgym #fitnessmalaysia #malaysiafitness #singaporefitness #fitnesssingapore #sgfitness #sgfitfam

Everything counts when it comes to calories.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
And that, my dears, is a FACT!
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Have you ever been shocked by how calorific a particular food is? Let me know in the comments what's surprised you the most.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
80 plus calories isn't much but that's not the point of this post. I'm just doing my thang and helping you become more calorie aware. If you aren't already.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
If you're the type of person who likes to have lots of licks and bites then this post is even more important, especially if you're trying to lose fat or maintain.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
As I said, 80 calories isn't much but what if you habitually eat 2 slices of bread? That's 160 calories extra. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Just like that!
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Nut butter's are often considered healthy spreads but are also very calorie-dense. For example, a tbsp (16g) of peanut butter can be around 100 calories.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
There's nothing wrong with eating any of the foods or having those calories (although they may not be the most nutritious) so go ahead and eat them and make them fit into your calorie goals if you want to.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
#bread #nutella #hkfitness #fitnesshk #減肥 #bbghk #hkgym #fitnessmalaysia #malaysiafitness #singaporefitness #fitnesssingapore #sgfitness #sgfitfam #caloriecounting #caloriecounted #caloriecounter #portioncontrolled #caloriesincaloriesout #caloriedeficit

4 Row mistakes to avoid and save yourself from injury.

Don't forget to like and save this video so that you can do a form check next time you're in the gym.

If you want healthy shoulders and a strong and well developed back then it behoves me as a coach to warn you of these four common mistakes. 
It could be that you're doing one of these mistakes but it's possible that you're doing a combination of them.

Either way, take the time to check your form against my video to ensure that you're performing rows correctly.

The correct form with your shoulders and posture applies to all rowing actions. 
#exercisevideo #backday #backrows #seatedrow #exercisetips
#hkfitness #fitnesshk #減肥 #bbghk #hkgym #fitnessmalaysia #malaysiafitness #singaporefitness #fitnesssingapore #sgfitness #sgfitfam

Jedi mind tricks that'll get you leaner and dominate your scale weight.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
So, my muscle gain phase is going well LOL! And yes, I'm going to gain fat since I'm eating in a caloric surplus and that's ok with me because that's the side effect of trying to gain precious muscle. The reason I have this mindset? This leads me to my first tip.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
#1 Gaining fat can be a means to an end, especially if you're skinny fat. The end being lean and "toned". You probably have a vision or a dream of how your body will look when you reach your goal. I'm here to shatter that dream because you won't achieve that dream in one go. The journey isn't going to be A-Z. You're more likely to go from A-D then D-C and then C-F, etc. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
The only people that will get lean in one go are already genetically gifted and have a decent amount of muscle mass, to begin with.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
#2 Have performance-based goals like being able to perform a proper pull-up, push-up, squatting 1.5 x bodyweight or deadlift 2 times your body weight. I guarantee if you can do these you will be fairly lean or at least ever closer to your dream body.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
#3 Record all your lifts for every training session and attempt to improve upon them each time you train. Try to set personal records (PR's). Rather than obsessing over your scale weight obsess over these worthy numbers.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
#4 Ditch the random sh!t. Stop doing the flavour of the week Instagram influencer workout. Follow a program and stick with it by focusing on #3. If you're being random, how the heck will you be able to track progress? ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
#5 Chime in with your tip in the comments.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Remember, focus on the process and think of your body as a lifelong project.
--
#hkfitness #fitnesshk #hkgym #fitnessmalaysia #malaysiafitness #singaporefitness #fitnesssingapore #sgfitness #sgfitfam #womensweightloss #fitnessmums #fitnessmum #femalefatloss #womenwholift #strengthtrainingforwomen #girlswholiftweights #weightliftinggirls #musclegain #musclegains #fitness #leanaf #getlean

The weight that really matters is the weight you lift.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Give this a like if you agree.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Dear "yo-yo dieter" or "forever dieter", if only you would obsess about how much weight you're lifting as much as your scale weight.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
BTW, if you don't partake in resistance training then you should get on it NOW because if you don't you're doing yourself a huge disservice, both from an aesthetic POV and an overall health perspective.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
The fact is, your dream body is much more likely to be achieved if you do resistance training with an emphasis on getting stronger, which means lifting more weight for any given exercise and up to a point, more repetitions over time.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Doing this and ensuring you get adequate protein which is about 0.7-1g of protein per pound of body weight and at the least maintaining your weight if you remain patient then the chances are 1-2 years down the line you're going to see an amazing transformation in your body. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Yes, you heard right. 1-2 years!
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
There isn't any quick fix and anyone that promises you otherwise is an untrustworthy nincompoop.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Get stronger and the aesthetic changes will follow.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Have you found this to be true? Leave a comment and share your experience if you have. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
#fitness #strengthtraining #getstrong #getstronger #liftweights #weightwatcher #weightwatcherlife #weightwatchersgirl #womensweightloss #fitnessmums #fitnessmum #femalefatloss #womenwholift #strengthtrainingforwomen #girlswholiftweights #weightliftinggirls #hkfitness #fitnesshk #減肥 #bbghk #hkgym #fitnessmalaysia #malaysiafitness #singaporefitness #fitnesssingapore #sgfitness #sgfitfam

This upper body workout was brutal! ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
*Save for reference* ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Do you know the feeling when you’ve had an extended break from the gym and  on your return you feel weak and feeble? ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
You can’t lift nearly as much weight as you could before or your reps are significantly less ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
You feel frustrated and angry because you’re a shadow of your former self. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
This is how I felt after this upper body training session LOL! ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Have you ever felt this way? ⠀⠀

What do I think of The Game Changers?
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Read to the end because my conclusion may surprise you because it certainly surprised me!
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
I'm going to be upfront with you, I haven't watched it and I don't plan to. Despite it being a great topic to create content around.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Here are 2 reasons why I don't plan on watching it. #1, it's on Netflix. Which means it's made from probably two perspectives only.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
a. Bias towards veganism 
b. Hyperbole to entertain.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
#2 Not to sound arrogant but (I'll probably come across that way) A TV show isn't going to tell me anything that I don't already know about the consensus of the body of scientific literature regarding veganism. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
One example topic presented in the show (or documentary if you like) is protein. It doesn't matter how you slice it or dice it, animal protein is superior to vegan protein. This is a scientific fact. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
It's also much much easier to get adequate protein from animal protein. This is especially important if you lift and your protein requirements are much higher than sedentary folk.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Peanut butter is a sh!te source of protein and very calorie-dense too. I thought I'd throw that in since I heard it was mentioned.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Despite what I've said above let me give you my take on The Game Changers. I liken it to Crossfit. You know, the form of exercise that its participants can't stop talking about. All the time. To everyone. And the one that claims to produce the fittest male and female athletes in the world?
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Despite its shortfalls, Crossfit has motivated more men AND women to pick up a barbell and start lifting than any bodybuilder ever could. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Since lifting is such an important form of exercise that can only be a positive thing. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
IF. That's a big IF. The Game Changers has that same positive impact on people's eating habits and lifestyles then it's OK in my books. Except for all the BS and misinformation of course LOL!
#thegamechangers #vegan #veganism #diet #protein #animalprotein #plantprotein

It was important so I ate it and then I didn't and then I learned the truth.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Do you eat breakfast and do you feel hungry at breakfast?
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
There was once a time where I thought breakfast was the single most important meal of the day. That's what everyone was saying. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
The cereal companies said it. I wonder why? Even "experts" claimed that eating breakfast was vital to speeding up your metabolism, losing fat, general health and for the bro's, prevent muscle loss.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
I use to stress about these things a lot!
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
If I didn't have breakfast it would not only make me anxious, I would also be in a foul mood for the day. Until lunch at least. It bothered me that much.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Then I discovered Intermittent Fasting and then I began to skip breakfast for the next 2 years LOL! ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
It's funny looking back now that skipping breakfast is deemed good by intermittent fasters and bad by every other Tom, Dick and Harry. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Then I learned the simple truth. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
After years of intermittent fasting, it became clear as day to me that breakfast and I were made for each other.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Eat breakfast. Don't eat breakfast. Do whatever the hell suits you because you only have one life and it's not worth stressing over something that is in fact insignificant.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
People that don't have an appetite in the morning tend to do the best by skipping breakfast and people that find themselves hungry in the morning are typically better off eating #breakfast.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
You might be wondering about some of the science behind breakfast eaters being less overweight or able to lose more weight, well it's simple really. It's a simple case of correlation. Those people just so happen, on average have healthier lifestyles and habits, to begin with.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Remember, do what best suits you and stop sweating the small stuff. Do you hear me?
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
#pancake #pancakesunday #weightloss #losingweight #nutrition #intermittentfasting #skylinefilter

This simple scientific workout is glorious to behold! ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
I know, I know it’s a click bait title. I had to get your attention somehow.

BTW, let me know in the comments if you mind or don’t mind the click bait title:) ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Give this a whirl if you don’t have much time. You can also use dumbbells which means for some l, you can do this workout at home. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀

I FELT HOPELESS, LOST AND GAINED FAT
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Over two weeks ago I had stopped posting on Instagram and I only managed to workout once in 2½ weeks because of a complete and utter lack of interest and motivation.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
I'm not going to go into detail about what triggered all this off because this is not the time or place to talk about it.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
But I will say that I was feeling completely unmotivated, unhappy, fearful, stressed and sad and although it's easy to label it as depression I won't because I don't want to use the word lightly. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
During this time I ate and ate and ate. LOTS! TOO MUCH!
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
And it wasn't the good stuff either. I ate emotionally and I couldn't stop myself. I craved something...everything!
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
And I regained some fat. And I'll admit that because of where my head was at I felt horrible, uneasy and uncomfortable with the extra little iddy bitty fat that I had gained. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
But one day I suddenly realised that I was letting things that were completely out of my control get to me and just by realising this I started to heal. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
I also began to focus on the bright side of life like how lucky I am to have my family and enjoy my work. I also began to look at the things that I could control and the things that I could do to make myself feel better.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
EXERCISE is a huge part of that. So I decided to change up my training and diet. I started an upper/lower split and I changed my intensity to give my joints a rest from all the previous heavy lifting during my fat loss phase.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
My goal is to build muscle for the next 3 months because this allows me to eat more and it also coincides nicely with the time of year and some big eating holidays.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
I guess what I'm trying to say is, I'm not perfect, and there are times that I go off the rail and times when I don't feel happy with my body even if I only gained a little bit of fat.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
I totally understand that you struggle with similar challenges too but I just want you to know that you're not alone. Together we can become stronger.

🏋️‍♀️Dumbbells Vs Barbells🏋️‍♂️ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
I was recently asked whether training with barbells was better than dumbbells and the answer is, if you have access to both then use them. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
One is not better than the other because they each have their pros and cons. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
As a rule of thumb, barbells are easier to progress and great for building strength because you can increase the weight in smaller increments. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Assuming you’re already lifting at your maximum for 6-8 reps using 50 lbs for a barbell exercise you can increase the load by +5lbs making it 55lbs in total. That’s a 10% increase in weight. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Similarly if you were using 2 x 25lbs dumbbells and you wanted to go up a weight, the next weight up is 30lbs making it a 20% increase in weight. This is one major advantage barbells have over dumbbells. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Dumbbells however, are versatile and great for lifting with a greater range of motion and allow a more natural movement and therefore can be more joint friendly. .
Dumbbells are arguably easier and safer too because you can't use as heavy a weight as you could on the same exercise with a barbell. .
Using a chest press as an example you can simply place (drop) the weights on the floor if you fail whereas if you were under a bar that could be potentially hazardous. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
I could go on but I think you get the idea. Use both.
.
What’s your experience been with dumbbells and barbells? Do you have a preference and a reason for that preference?
—

Do you see what I'm trying to say here?

Progress update - Day I don't even care.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
This is a prime example of why your scale weight can sometimes be a complete mind f@$K!
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
So I'm weighing more now than after my initial 12-Day Fat Blast and based on today's #dailyweighin I've lost a paltry 1.6kg LOL!
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
But if you look at the photos do I look like I've gained fat? You be the judge.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
I've most definitely gained weight. There's no doubt about that. But there's a good reason for that. For the last month, I've been eating at least at maintenance or more. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
I've had quite a few social events and meet-ups with old friends that I hadn't seen in years so I deliberately started back eating at maintenance. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Sometimes I've been a little too indulgent. Truth be told, there have been times where I can't control my eating. I just want to eat for the sake of it. To the point of discomfort. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
That's life! You have your ups and downs. Sometimes your body, and dare I say, hormones, just don't want to cooperate.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
I wish I hadn't mentioned the hormones now LOL! ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Don't use that as an excuse.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
I've been doing 2 x full body weights each week and 1 x 30-minute cardio a week for the last 2 weeks. The 2 weeks before that I didn't do any cardio at all because lazy. Actually, I’m going through a phase of zero motivation.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
I personally feel that I may have gained a little fat because I have been overdoing it with the eating. But it really isn't much nor is it a big deal.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
I'm thinking about going back to a deficit either next week or the week after because I'm still considering whether to get shredded for a photoshoot. Let's see.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀

7 Common push-up mistakes ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Did I miss anything? ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Have you ever made any of these mistakes? ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
I want to point out that #4, bending through the arms only like I’m doing it, is a whole exercise in itself. If you are able to perform this then your triceps and your core will be reasonably strong. However, it’s not a basic push-up. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Push-ups are usually butchered because of a lack of core strength and/or triceps strength ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
If you can’t perform them properly then increase the height that you place your hands to create a greater incline. That way the exercise becomes easier and you can focus on improving your technique and actually getting stronger ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
I hope this video helps you improve in this staple and awesome body weight exercise. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀

Can’t feel your back? ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Training and actually feeling your back is a real challenge for a lot of people so here are 4 tips to help you. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
These tips are designed to help you use your back as opposed to your arms which is a common problem. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Know that it’s the upper arm that the lats are attached to and therefore for any back exercise it’s your upper arm that you should be focused on moving. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
